revised_title: Astrophiura permira: An Echinoderm-Form Bridging Ophiuroidea and Asteroidea
tldr: The article describes Astrophiura permira, an echinoderm with characteristics of both Ophiuroidea and Asteroidea. Its unique anatomy, including a combination of ophiuroid disk- and arm-structure within a pentagonal asteroid form, suggests that it may bridge the differences between the two orders.
